newsitem.title: USA: Bell Atlantic, Nynex, Pactel to downsize TELE-TV.
newsitem.headline: Bell Atlantic, Nynex, Pactel to downsize TELE-TV.

text.p: Bell Atlantic Corp, NYNEX Corp, and Pacific Telesis Group said Friday they were downsizing their TELE-TV partnership venture, a move that would eliminate 100 TELE-TV positions in New York, Los Angeles, Reston, Va., and San Ramon, Ca.
The companies also said Howard Stringer resigned as TELE-TV chairman and chief executive. Newspaper reports have said that Stringer is in talks to receive a senior position at Sony Corp of America.
With his departure, TELE-TV Media will continue to be run by chief operating officer David Grant, and TELE-TV Systems will be run by president Ed Grebow, the companies said.

The companies said remaining employees will be based primarily in Reston and Los Angeles, and added that some of the employees in positions to be eliminated will be offered positions with the partners.
TELE-TV was formed by the partners in 1994 to jointly develop home entertainment, information and interactive services.
The downsizing will enable TELE-TV to more cost-effectively support the individual video strategies of its owners, the companies said.

"...the partners' evolving strategies for video services made it clear that it was simply not cost-effective to support the current level of TELE-TV operations for the foreseeable future," they said in a statement.
